awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner Special Award
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MEN taught the world to sing of television as an art form. With a monumental final episode to a landmark run spanning nine years, Matthew Weiner's meticulously crafted series transcended the tube to become a true cultural touchstone. AFI offers a two-martini toast to an American masterpiece, brought to life by an incomparable creative ensemble.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2015 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MEN tees up the beginning of its end by surpassing the impossibly high standards it has set as one of television's most celebrated series. Long telegraphed by the now iconic opening credits, Don Draper's prophesied fall is nonetheless filled with surprises in a world lavish with the period nuances emblematic of Matt Weiner's eye and ear for detailed perfection. Reinventing their lives and their lines with each new show is an exquisite ensemble led by Jon Hamm.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2014 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MEN cuts a fashionable figure in its impeccably tailored sixth year - which finds Jon Hamm's Don Draper and a stellar ensemble careening through the dark days of 1968. Creator Matt Weiner's stylish stories serve as both a poetic recreation of America's past and a sobering reminder that nothing endures but change.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2013 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MEN stands tall in the history of television, sealing the deal again in 2012 with its signature cocktail - one part seductive grace and two parts unbridled intellect. Matthew Weiner and his endlessly elegant ensemble shake and stir audiences with a mixture of narrative bravado and a visual flair that continues to make the dark side of the American Dream endlessly intoxicating.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2011 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (MAD MEN's fourth and finest year saw the wheels come off Don Draper's formerly golden life, and Jon Hamm rose to new heights in depicting Don's depths. Creator Matt Weiner is a master of the medium, and our empathy for his characters in a world mad with change is a tribute to the rich, emotional detail of each word, each glance - beautifully realized in the performances of a stellar ensemble cast.)

awardsHtml:
143 wins & 406 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2015 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series
Jon Hamm (For playing "Don Draper".)
2015 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series
Elisabeth Moss (For playing "Peggy Olson".)
2015 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series
Christina Hendricks (For playing "Joan Harris".)
2015 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Writing for a Drama Series
Matthew Weiner (For Person to Person (2015))
2015 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Writing for a Drama Series
Matthew Weiner - Semi Chellas (For Lost Horizon (2015))

BAFTA Awards

2011 Nominee BAFTA TV Award
Best International
Matthew Weiner - Scott Hornbacher - Jennifer Getzinger
2010 Winner BAFTA TV Award
Best International
Matthew Weiner - Scott Hornbacher
2009 Winner BAFTA TV Award
Best International
Matthew Weiner - Scott Hornbacher

Gold Derby Awards

Drama Series of the Decade
(3rd place)

Drama Actress of the Decade
Elisabeth Moss
2019 Nominee Gold Derby TV Award
Drama Actor of the Decade
Jon Hamm (2nd place)
2019 Nominee Gold Derby TV Award
Drama Supporting Actress of the Decade
Christina Hendricks
2019 Nominee Gold Derby TV Award
Drama Supporting Actor of the Decade
John Slattery

AFI Awards, USA

2016 Winner Special Award
(MAD MEN taught the world to sing of television as an art form. With a monumental final episode to a landmark run spanning nine years, Matthew Weiner's meticulously crafted series transcended the tube to become a true cultural touchstone. AFI offers a two-martini toast to an American masterpiece, brought to life by an incomparable creative ensemble.)
2015 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(MAD MEN tees up the beginning of its end by surpassing the impossibly high standards it has set as one of television's most celebrated series. Long telegraphed by the now iconic opening credits, Don Draper's prophesied fall is nonetheless filled with surprises in a world lavish with the period nuances emblematic of Matt Weiner's eye and ear for detailed perfection. Reinventing their lives and their lines with each new show is an exquisite ensemble led by Jon Hamm.)
2014 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(MAD MEN cuts a fashionable figure in its impeccably tailored sixth year - which finds Jon Hamm's Don Draper and a stellar ensemble careening through the dark days of 1968. Creator Matt Weiner's stylish stories serve as both a poetic recreation of America's past and a sobering reminder that nothing endures but change.)
2013 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(MAD MEN stands tall in the history of television, sealing the deal again in 2012 with its signature cocktail - one part seductive grace and two parts unbridled intellect. Matthew Weiner and his endlessly elegant ensemble shake and stir audiences with a mixture of narrative bravado and a visual flair that continues to make the dark side of the American Dream endlessly intoxicating.)
2011 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(MAD MEN's fourth and finest year saw the wheels come off Don Draper's formerly golden life, and Jon Hamm rose to new heights in depicting Don's depths. Creator Matt Weiner is a master of the medium, and our empathy for his characters in a world mad with change is a tribute to the rich, emotional detail of each word, each glance - beautifully realized in the performances of a stellar ensemble cast.)

American Cinema Editors, USA

2016 Winner Eddie
Best Edited One-Hour Series for Commercial Television
Tom Wilson (Episode: "Person to Person (2015)")
2015 Nominee Eddie
